metadata.title: CVE-2021-1095 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Windows and Linux contains a vulnerability inthe kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handlers for all control calls withembedded parameters where dereferencing an untrusted pointer may lead todenial of service.

criterions.comment: nvidia-graphics-drivers-304: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-304-updates: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-340: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
nvidia-graphics-drivers-384: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
